intro: Ouratea insulae, commonly known as the island ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
